item.title: A bin has randomly appeared on College Cross, 20th September
item.description:
A bin which is of the style on upper street has been located in the middle of the pavement without any warning and this triggers people to dump rubbish including dog poo bags. This is not a main road and there is no reason for a bin to have been put there.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 23, College Cross, Highbury, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Excessive number of bikes outside of designated parking zone, 20th September
item.description:
There are a significant number of bikes many of which are on the public highway rather than in the designated area. This is increasingly problematic as some also get left on pavements. There seems to be no controlling of the designated areas.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 23, College Cross, Highbury, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead fox in our drive, 20th September
item.description:
The fox is dead on our drive at 426 Erith Road DA8 3NJ must have died under our car which isnâ€™t driven much. We moved the car today and found the dead fox which also explains the smell we have had in our front of the house. Can we please get this removed please

item.title: Someone have left 2 bags of rubbish, 20th September
item.description:

item.title: Fly tipping Eltham hill, kings ground SE9 5ED, 20th September
item.description:
Fly tipping has been happening. A few days ago a big pile of rubbish was cleared which was dumped by fly tippers. Now again last night on 19/08/2025 I saw a van coming in to the parking and dumped whole van full of rubbish. As soon as I try to approach they ran away swearing at me.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 134-144, Eltham Hill, Well Hall, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Misused rubbish bin- danger to drivers (5). Summary includes number of times same recurring offence reported since 16/09/2025., 20th September
item.description:
This rubbish bin is daily used for domestic rubbish. Wind often takes debris and bags to the middle of the road and it is an accident waiting to happen. I have already witnessed a motorist and a cyclist falling trying to avoid the debris. The solution is to remove the bin or to apply existing legislation and fine the recurring offenders.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12, West Eaton Place, Belgravia, London
Report on FixMyStreet
